content: My 1.7.1 install just generated four tracebacks. Looks like it's centered around user activity updates?

So the first 3 came in around 10:47 and 10:48. Then the last one came in at 12:19. That time about matches when jumped on the site to if it was still running.
@Scott Russell I bet your machine did a postgres auto-update via apt at around that time.
Basically, each Zulip queue worker will get an error the next time it tries to use the database, and auto-restart.
You'll probably get a few more of those over the coming days, which you could circumvent by doing a Zulip server restart manually.
(I happen to know a Postgres security update came out this morning)
I generally turn off the Ubuntu "unattended upgrades" feature to avoid these sorts of updates happening when I'm not paying attention.
